full_job_description:
Panel Wirer
Contract role 
Machine Building Industry
Leicester, LE8
Days Shifts - Early Finish Friday
Pay rate £22 CIS or £17 Paye 
Are you an experienced Panel Wirer looking for an exciting Contract opportunity within a developing industry? If yes, read on.... 
I'm excited to share an opportunity with a forward-thinking engineering company that's on the lookout for an experienced Panel Wireman or Control Wirer. This is an ideal role for someone who thrives in high-precision environments and has a proven track record in Panel Wiring. 
The Role - Panel Wirer:
- Building and wiring control panels
- Machine wiring
- Working to wiring schematics
- Using a variety of hand tools
- Day Shifts, Early Finish Friday
 Minimum Skills / Experience Required - Panel Wireman:
- Extensive experience in panel wiring or machine control wiring
- Strong understanding and experience with schematics
- Ability to use the required hand tools
- The ability to work with minimal supervision and deliver high standards
- Problem-solving skills and attention to detail
- Motivated and excellent team player
- Able to commute to the LE8 area
 The Package - Electrical Fitter:
- Basic salary of £17 per hour paye or £22 CIS
- Overtime available daily
- Free onsite parking
About PrecisionPeople
PrecisionPeople is a leading recruitment agency that specialises in sourcing top talent for Engineering, Technical, Sales and Senior Management roles across a wide range of industries. With a focus on precision and quality, their team of expert recruiters works tirelessly to match the best candidates with the right employers, ensuring that both parties benefit from a successful partnership. 
PrecisionPeople has the expertise and resources to help you find the perfect role. With a deep understanding of the industry and a commitment to excellence, they have built a reputation for delivering exceptional results and exceeding their candidates expectations.

description_snippet:
Experience Required - 
 Production Supervisor 
Fabrication shop  
Engineering Manufacturing Industry 
Leicester LE3  
Up to
responsibilities_snippet:
- To lead, motivate and manage a team of fabricators on a daily basis.
- Liaising with the office regarding bespoke requirements and sharing thoughts and experience regarding more complex specifications.
- To oversee all works being carried out in the workshop to ensure customer satisfaction at all times.
- Interpreting drawings received.
- Welding various fabricated material.
- Oversee laser cutting, shearing, folding, punching, and rubbering material using the relevant machinery.
- Arranging adequate and relevant training for new and existing staff as necessary.
- Working with other staff members effectively by coordinating workload.
- Adhering to health and safety regulations.
- All other duties as required that are considered to be a reasonable employer request.
- At least 5 years' experience in metal sheet fabrication.
- Competent with all aspect of fabrication.
- Use of CAD drawings
- Forklift licence would be preferable but not essential
- Accurate measuring ability and good numeracy skills and experience of using measuring equipment.
- The ability to understand the drawings provided.
- Relevant qualifications would be desirable.
- Previous welding/sheet metal experience essential.
- Amada machinery experience preferable.

full_job_description:
Business Development Lead
Leicester
£25,000-£30,000
Office-based Monday-Friday
Are you a driven sales professional with a passion for building relationships, uncovering new opportunities, and delivering exceptional customer service? We're supporting our client in recruiting a Business Development Lead to join their dynamic Sales team.
This is a fantastic opportunity for someone with proven sales success who's ready to take ownership of growing revenue, nurturing accounts, and supporting wider sales activity within a busy branch environment.
The Role
As the Business Development Lead, you will be responsible for driving new business, managing enquiries, supporting customers, and ensuring all sales processes run smoothly. You will be a key player within the internal sales environment, working closely with the Branch Manager and Area Sales Managers to maximise opportunities.
Key Responsibilities
- Handling inbound customer enquiries professionally and promptly
- Investigating and researching new business opportunities across dormant and new accounts
- Delivering customer service that goes above and beyond expectations
- Creating, pricing, and closing quotations, ensuring all details are recorded accurately
- Issuing quotes on the same day and managing communication around any delays
- Following the sales strategies set by the Sales Director
- Calling customers to chase orders, quotes, and purchase orders
- Prioritising all sales-related tasks to maximise conversion
- Liaising daily with Area Sales Managers on sales documentation, leads, and support needs
- Updating CRM/emir systems with quotes, notes, job cards, photos, and files
- General sales administration and supporting the Branch Manager as required
- Taking on additional duties in line with the needs of the business
Skills & Experience
- Proven experience in business development, internal sales, or outbound sales
- Strong track record of generating new business and nurturing existing accounts
- Confident in making outbound calls, chasing enquiries and converting quotes into orders
- Excellent customer service skills and a professional telephone manner
- Strong communication skills with the ability to build rapport quickly
- Highly organised with the ability to manage multiple tasks while maintaining accuracy
- Self-motivated and able to work independently as well as part of a wider team
- Comfortable working to targets and deadlines
About PrecisionPeople
PrecisionPeople is a leading recruitment agency that specialises in sourcing top talent for Engineering, Technical, Sales and Senior Management roles across a wide range of industries. With a focus on precision and quality, their team of expert recruiters works tirelessly to match the best candidates with the right employers, ensuring that both parties benefit from a successful partnership.
PrecisionPeople has the expertise and resources to help you find the perfect role. With a deep understanding of the industry and a commitment to excellence, they have built a reputation for delivering exceptional results and exceeding their candidates expectations.
Interested?
To apply for the position, here are your two options:
1. "This is the job for me! When can I start?" - Call now and let’s talk through your experience. Ask for Kirsty on (phone number removed) between 8.00am - 5.00pm.
2. "I think I'm right for this position, but I'm not sure I have enough to get an interview" - Click "apply now" so I can read your CV and let you know.
PPTP

full_job_description:
Production Scheduler  
Location: Leicester  
Salary: up to £40,000 DOE40-hour working week: Mon–Thu 07:30–16:45, Fri 07:30–12:30   
A long-established, fast-growing manufacturing business is seeking a highly motivated Production Scheduler to join its expanding operations team.   
You will be responsible for building and maintaining an accurate production schedule, ensuring work is released to the shop floor in line with customer requirements and agreed delivery dates.  
Key Responsibilities
- Develop and maintain a detailed production schedule across all manufacturing departments, ensuring output aligns with customer commitments as a Production Scheduler
- Release jobs to production with complete and accurate information, supporting smooth workflow and minimising disruption.
- Analyse demand and capacity to optimise work centre loading, avoid bottlenecks, and maximise utilisation of machinery and labour.
- Monitor production progress in real time, proactively adjusting schedules in response to operational changes, labour availability, or equipment issues.
- Maintain full visibility and traceability of work in progress using scheduling tools and reporting systems as a Production Scheduler
- Collaborate closely with Sales, Estimating, Operations, and Procurement to ensure production plans support overall business priorities.
- Support proactive customer communication by reviewing delivery changes during office-stage processing and ensuring timely escalation where needed.
- Identify and resolve scheduling issues such as material shortages, lead-time variances, and resource conflicts.
- Track and report on key KPIs, including:
- Drive continuous improvement in planning accuracy and production efficiency through data-driven analysis.
- Work alongside Production Management and IT support to enhance ERP and planning systems.
- Take ownership of scheduling KPIs such as schedule adherence and DIFOT (Delivery in Full, On Time), analysing variances, and driving corrective actions as a Production Scheduler
Minimum Skills / Experience Required:  
- Proven experience in production scheduling or planning within a manufacturing environment.
- Strong understanding of ERP systems and planning principles, with confidence in interpreting system-generated data.
- Excellent organisational and time-management abilities.
- High level of accuracy, attention to detail, and commitment to quality.
- Self-motivated, adaptable, and able to work using your own initiative.
- Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a professional and courteous manner.
- Integrity, honesty, and a positive attitude toward innovation and change.
- Ambition to build a long-term career within a growing business.
description_snippet: A long-established, fast-growing manufacturing business is seeking a highly motivated Production Scheduler to join its expanding operations team. You will be responsible for building and maintaining an accurate production schedule, ensuring work is released to the shop floor in line with customer requirements and agreed delivery dates.
responsibilities_snippet: Key Responsibilities: Develop and maintain a detailed production schedule across all manufacturing departments, ensuring output aligns with customer commitments as a Production Scheduler. Release jobs to production with complete and accurate information, supporting smooth workflow and minimising disruption. Analyse demand and capacity to optimise work centre loading, avoid bottlenecks, and maximise utilisation of machinery and labour. Monitor production progress in real time, proactively adjusting schedules in response to operational changes, labour availability, or equipment issues. Maintain full visibility and traceability of work in progress using scheduling tools and reporting systems as a Production Scheduler. Collaborate closely with Sales, Estimating, Operations, and Procurement to ensure production plans support overall business priorities. Support proactive customer communication by reviewing delivery changes during office-stage processing and ensuring timely escalation where needed. Identify and resolve scheduling issues such as material shortages, lead-time variances, and resource conflicts. Track and report on key KPIs, including: Drive continuous improvement in planning accuracy and production efficiency through data-driven analysis. Work alongside Production Management and IT support to enhance ERP and planning systems. Take ownership of scheduling KPIs such as schedule adherence and DIFOT (Delivery in Full, On Time), analysing variances, and driving corrective actions as a Production Scheduler. Minimum Skills / Experience Required: Proven experience in production scheduling or planning within a manufacturing environment. Strong understanding of ERP systems and planning principles, with confidence in interpreting system-generated data. Excellent organisational and time-management abilities. High level of accuracy, attention to detail, and commitment to quality. Self-motivated, adaptable, and able to work using your own initiative. Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a professional and courteous manner. Integrity, honesty, and a positive attitude toward innovation and change. Ambition to build a long-term career within a growing business.

full_job_description: About the Company: A well-established engineering and manufacturing business, recognised for producing high-quality sheet metal and fabricated components for a range of industries. With ongoing investment in modern machinery and a commitment to developing their people, they're now seeking an experienced Press Brake Setter Operator to join their team. The Press Brake Setter Operator Role: As a Press Brake Setter Operator, you'll be responsible for setting, operating, and adjusting CNC press brake machines to produce precision sheet metal parts in line with customer specifications. Key Responsibilities: - Set and operate CNC press brake machines (Amada, Bystronic, Trumpf, or similar). - Read and interpret technical drawings and engineering plans. - Carry out first-off inspections and ensure quality throughout production. - Adjust machine settings and tooling to achieve accurate folds and dimensions. - Maintain equipment, report faults, and ensure safe working practices. - Work efficiently to meet production targets and deadlines. About You - Proven experience setting and operating CNC press brakes. - Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings. - Positive, proactive attitude with good communication skills.

full_job_description: Do you want to progress into a General Manager role within the next 6 months? Our client is a Scandinavian–New York inspired brunch restaurant built on friendship, connection, and exceptional coffee. Their calm, design-led space offers a welcoming home for people who appreciate craft — from perfectly pulled espresso shots to beautifully plated brunch dishes. Due to their growth, they are expanding their leadership team and are looking for an ambitious professional to join their team. This role is ideal for a seasoned hospitality manager with strong barista skills and a passion for people. The role Assistant General Manager * Oversee daily operations, service flow, and team performance. * Uphold high standards of coffee, food, and atmosphere. * Manage compliance, rotas, stock control, and reporting. * Lead by example during busy brunch periods. * Manage stock control, cost efficiency and supplier orders. Senior Barista (essential) * Lead all aspects of coffee preparation, training, and quality control. * Support daily operations, rotas, and guest experience alongside the GM. * Act as floor lead when the GM is away. * Maintain EHO and hygiene compliance with precision and care. * Maintain excellent customer service ensuring all issues are resolved The candidate: * Minimum 2 years’ management experience in a premium café, brunch restaurant, or boutique hospitality setting. * Minimum 2 years’ barista experience, ideally at senior or lead level. * Basic food hygiene or EHO knowledge desirable * Confident in workflow management and team leadership. * Weekend availability essential. What is on offer: * Competitive pay (based on experience) * Daytime hours: typically between 08:00–19:00 * Opportunities for growth within a creative, design-led concept * Supportive and inspiring working culture Interested? Please click ‘Apply’ today!
description_snippet: The role is for an Assistant General Manager at a Scandinavian–New York inspired brunch restaurant in Leicester City Centre, with the potential to progress to a General Manager role within 6 months. The position requires a seasoned hospitality manager with strong senior-level barista skills and a passion for people. Responsibilities include overseeing daily operations, managing compliance, stock control, and leading coffee preparation and quality control. The role offers competitive pay, daytime hours (typically 08:00–19:00), and growth opportunities within a design-led concept.

Manage compliance, rotas, stock control, and reporting. Lead by example during busy brunch periods. Manage stock control, cost efficiency and supplier orders. Responsibilities (Senior Barista - essential): Lead all aspects of coffee preparation, training, and quality control. Support daily operations, rotas, and guest experience alongside the GM. Act as floor lead when the GM is away. Maintain EHO and hygiene compliance with precision and care. Maintain excellent customer service ensuring all issues are resolved. Requirements/Skills (The candidate): Minimum 2 years’ management experience in a premium café, brunch restaurant, or boutique hospitality setting. Minimum 2 years’ barista experience, ideally at senior or lead level. Basic food hygiene or EHO knowledge desirable. Confident in workflow management and team leadership. Weekend availability essential.

full_job_description:
Want to see your welds make a real impact?
If you’ve got MIG welding experience and want to join a company that actually invests in your skills, this is the one. You’ll be working on high quality sheet metal projects for major customers, using modern equipment in a clean, organised workshop where precision and pride really matter.
This is a busy, long established manufacturer in Loughborough with around 100 staff and a full order book stretching well into next year. They’re known locally for looking after their people, promoting from within and offering genuine training opportunities to help you progress in your career.
Job Title:	MIG Welder  
Location:	Loughborough, Leicestershire  
Hours:	Rotating shifts Monday to Friday, 06:00-14:00 / 14:00-22:00  
Contract Type:	Permanent  
Pay:	£14.00 - £15.50 per hour (based on experience, reviewed after probation)  
Benefits:
Profit Share Scheme, Multi Skilled Bonus (£1/hr extra), Overtime Pay Premiums, 30 Days Holiday (Including Bank Holidays), Enhanced Sick Pay and Healthcare Plan, Group Life Cover, Clear Career Progression Path, Training and Upskilling Opportunities, Internal Promotion Opportunities and Cycle to Work Scheme.
Your Responsibilities:
- Carry out MIG welding on sheet metal components, ensuring strong and accurate welds
- Set up and adjust welding equipment for various materials and specifications
- Read and interpret engineering drawings to achieve precise, consistent results
- Perform quality checks using measuring tools to verify weld integrity
- Support grinding and finishing of welded components as required
What We’re Looking For:
- Proven experience in MIG welding within a manufacturing or fabrication environment
- Ability to interpret drawings and produce accurate, high quality welds
- Competence with grinders, finishing tools and fabrication equipment
- A good eye for detail and pride in producing clean, professional work
- Reliable, adaptable and confident working both independently and as part of a team
Recruitment Process:
To apply, simply upload your CV below or contact Josh Whitmore on (phone number removed) or (url removed)
Successful candidates will then be invited to an onsite interview and MIG welding skills test with the Team Leader.
Ready to take your welding career further with a company that values your craft?
*Your Recruiters Ltd is an equal opportunity employer, celebrating diversity and inclusion at every level. All applications receive a personal response, with detailed feedback for anyone interviewed but unsuccessful.*

full_job_description:
A growing engineering business specialising in the design and manufacture of bespoke automation and mechanical systems is seeking an experienced Engineering Project Manager to join its expanding team. The company operates across regulated and industrial sectors, delivering complex, high-precision systems that meet demanding technical and regulatory standards.
As a well-established and employee-focused organisation, the business continues to invest in innovation and people, with a strong pipeline of new projects and long-term customer partnerships.
**The Role**  
 As Engineering Project Manager, you’ll take ownership of multiple projects from initial concept through to final delivery. You will oversee planning, coordination, and execution across mechanical, electrical, software, and build disciplines—ensuring projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.
This is a hands-on, delivery-focused position that requires both technical understanding and strong commercial acumen. You’ll work closely with customers, engineering teams, and senior stakeholders to drive accountability and successful outcomes across the full project lifecycle.
**Key Responsibilities**
- Lead and manage several concurrent engineering projects (typically 3–4 at a time) from concept through to completion.
- Ensure all projects meet contractual and commercial milestones, including agreed payment stages.
- Take ownership of project budgets, costings, and margins.
- Plan and allocate resources effectively across design, build, and commissioning teams.
- Lead structured design reviews and ensure adherence to engineering standards and compliance requirements.
- Act as the main customer contact throughout the project, managing scope changes, risks, and technical queries.
- Ensure projects meet internal quality, documentation, and handover standards.
- Drive continuous improvement across processes, design delivery, and communication.
**About You**  
 We’re looking for an experienced and proactive Project Manager with a strong background in automation, machinery, or special-purpose equipment design. You’ll be commercially aware, technically capable, and confident managing cross-functional teams and customers in a dynamic environment.
**Key Skills & Experience**
- Degree-qualified in Mechanical Engineering or related discipline.
- Minimum 10 years’ experience managing engineering or automation projects.
- Strong technical understanding of automated systems, robotics, or machinery.
- Proven experience in regulated or high-precision industries (medical, healthcare, packaging, etc.).
- Confident managing budgets, timelines, and multi-disciplinary engineering teams.
- Skilled communicator with the ability to manage stakeholders at all levels.
- Proficient in Microsoft Project or similar project management tools.
**Personal Attributes**
- Hands-on and delivery-focused with a strong sense of ownership.
- Collaborative, calm under pressure, and customer-oriented.
- Able to balance technical, commercial, and operational priorities effectively.
- Willingness to travel occasionally within the UK and overseas.
**What’s on Offer**
- Competitive salary and benefits package.
- Opportunity to lead innovative engineering projects with real impact.
- A supportive environment with autonomy, variety, and career growth potential.
- Work within a forward-thinking, employee-driven business investing in technology and people.
If this role would be of interest to you, please click apply today.

salary_benefits: £45,000 - £50,000/annum. Benefits include: Permanent position, Free onsite parking, Company events, Company pension, Overtime available.
full_job_description:
Job Title: Toolroom Manager
Location: Leicestershire
Shift: Monday - Thursday, 8am - 5pm and Friday, 8am - 4pm
Pay: Up to £50,000 per annum
Benefits:
- Permanent position
- Free onsite parking
- Company events
- Company pension
- Overtime available
The Company
A well-established manufacturer of high-precision plastic injection moulds, supplying a range of key industries across the UK and Europe.
The Toolroom Manager Role:
We are currently seeking a driven and committed Toolroom Manager to join our growing team. This position has become available due to continued business growth, with projected expansion of over 50% in the next year. We're looking for motivated individuals to help us meet this demand.
We take pride in maintaining a clean, organised, and professional toolroom. The successful candidate will play a key role in sustaining and improving standards of organisation, cleanliness, and overall presentation.
- Liaise with the customer to understand their needs within a project and communicate this clearly to the design and manufacturing team.
- Tool design, Mould flow and DFM interrogation to check feasibility and suitability of the design against the customers and moulders needs.
- Understand and interrogate part and tool designs for manufacturability and efficiency
- Assign daily workload to the shopfloor staff and explain each job to them as required
- Troubleshoot manufacturing issues from CNC machining, EDM machining and fitting issues.
- Monitor progress and provide regular updates to customers
- Create project plans showing the timeline of key activities in the project
- Attend the final tool build checklist with the fitting team, making sure the quality standards are met before we despatch tooling to customers
- Buying of mould bases, standard mould parts, cutting tools and other workshop equipment.
- Project management of Chinese tooling, communicating with our project managers oversees to check progress and quality. International travel could be available but not essential.
- Attend tool trials and provide support to the process team for troubleshooting
- Review parts from trials and understand injection moulding process/tooling defects
- Create tooling rework plans and oversee trial loop until approved
About You:
- Strong technical background in plastics and tooling
- Experience in interpreting 2D and 3D engineering drawings
- Background in tool design, mould flow analysis, and DFM reviews
- Involvement in managing varied tooling projects from start to finish
- Hands-on experience with CNC machining, EDM, and tool fitting processes
- Proven people management and organisational skills
- Excellent attention to detail and quality standards
- Flexibility to adapt to different projects and changing priorities
- Strong communication skills to liaise with customers and internal teams
- Ability to create and manage project timelines and tooling plans

full_job_description:
Job Opportunity: CAD/CAM Engineer (Sheet Metal Manufacturing)
Location: Leicester, East Midlands
Salary: £27,000 - £32,000 per annum (DOE)
Hours: Monday - Thursday, 07:30 - 16:00 (40 hours per week), Friday 12:30 Finish
Type: Permanent, Full-Time
Start Date: Immediate
About the Company
Our client is a leading UK metal manufacturing specialist, they partner with major national brands across industries such as rail, transport, retail, and construction.
A family-run business, they pride themselves on their commitment to quality, investment in cutting-edge technology, and dedication to developing their people. With over 100 skilled employees, the company continues to grow year-on-year thanks to its focus on innovation, craftsmanship, and exceptional customer service.
The Role: CAD/CAM Engineer
As a CAD/CAM Engineer, you will play a crucial role in producing high-quality and dimensionally accurate engineering drawings and CNC programs for the manufacturing of sheet metal components. You will work closely with production and clients to ensure orders meet technical specifications, efficiency standards, and quality expectations.
Key Responsibilities
- Create accurate 2D CAD/CAM profiles in line with client specifications.
- Develop CNC programs that maximise efficiency in material use and machine time.
- Produce detailed manufacturing drawings for press, fabrication, and assembly operations.
- Update and modify CAD/CNC data as required.
- Maintain organised drawing and program records.
- Communicate clearly with clients regarding order details and requirements.
- Prepare Bill of Materials (BOM) lists for the purchasing team to ensure all project materials are available.
Skills & Experience
Essential:
- Proficiency in 2D CAD software (AutoCAD or TruTops preferred).
- Strong SolidWorks experience (sheet metal design essential).
- Solid understanding of sheet metal manufacturing processes.
- Confident user of MS Office / Office 365, particularly Excel and Teams.
Desirable:
- Experience with Trumpf CAM software (advantageous but not essential).
Personal Attributes
- Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in work.
- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
- Professional, approachable, and adaptable attitude.
- Focused and reliable under pressure.
- Innovative problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
- Enthusiastic about developing a long-term career in manufacturing.
Benefits
- Salary: £27,000 - £32,000 per annum (DOE).
- Quarterly bonus scheme (non-contractual).
- Life assurance.
- Enhanced holiday entitlement with service-linked increases.
- Pension scheme.
- Company-provided workwear and PPE.
- On-site gym, canteen, and parking.
- Employee Assistance Programme.
- Continuous training and career development opportunities.
About Regional Recruitment Services
This role is advertised by Regional Recruitment Services Ltd, an award-winning independent recruitment agency established in 2008. We specialise in connecting skilled professionals to opportunities across the Engineering, Industrial, and Technical sectors.
Contact Us: (phone number removed)
Visit: (url removed)
If you are passionate about precision engineering and want to progress your career with a respected and growing manufacturer, apply today or call our Industrial team for more details.
description_snippet: As a CAD/CAM Engineer, you will play a crucial role in producing high-quality and dimensionally accurate engineering drawings and CNC programs for the manufacturing of sheet metal components. You will work closely with production and clients to ensure orders meet technical specifications, efficiency standards, and quality expectations.
responsibilities_snippet:
Key Responsibilities:
- Create accurate 2D CAD/CAM profiles in line with client specifications.
- Develop CNC programs that maximise efficiency in material use and machine time.
- Produce detailed manufacturing drawings for press, fabrication, and assembly operations.
- Update and modify CAD/CNC data as required.
- Maintain organised drawing and program records.
- Communicate clearly with clients regarding order details and requirements.
- Prepare Bill of Materials (BOM) lists for the purchasing team to ensure all project materials are available.
Skills & Experience Essential:
- Proficiency in 2D CAD software (AutoCAD or TruTops preferred).
- Strong SolidWorks experience (sheet metal design essential).
- Solid understanding of sheet metal manufacturing processes.
- Confident user of MS Office / Office 365, particularly Excel and Teams.
Desirable:
- Experience with Trumpf CAM software (advantageous but not essential).
Personal Attributes:
- Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in work.
- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
- Professional, approachable, and adaptable attitude.
- Focused and reliable under pressure.
- Innovative problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
- Enthusiastic about developing a long-term career in manufacturing.

scraped_job_title: Customer Service Team Leader - Expiring soon!
salary_benefits: £30,000 - £40,000/annum plus company benefits. Up to £40,000 per annum. 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays. 10% discretionary bonus (up to 20% maximum). Free onsite parking and EV charging. Subsidised canteen. Employee Assistance Programme and wellbeing portal. A supportive, collaborative working environment with real career development potential.
full_job_description:
Customer Service Team Leader   
Location: Leicester   
Salary: Up to £40,000 per annum   
Contract: Permanent, full-time (37.5 hours, Monday-Friday)   
A leading international engineering and manufacturing group with a long-standing presence in Leicester is seeking an experienced Customer Service Team Leader to manage a small but busy team within their customer operations function. This is an exciting opportunity to join a world-class organisation supplying vibration control and precision-engineered products across multiple industries, including automotive, rail and industrial markets.   
The Role   
You'll be responsible for leading, coaching and developing a team of four Customer Service professionals, ensuring that all customer orders and enquiries are handled accurately, efficiently, and with exceptional service. Working closely with supply chain, production, and commercial teams, you'll be the central link between customers and internal operations - driving communication, problem resolution and continuous improvement.   
Key Responsibilities   
· Lead, motivate and develop the Customer Service team to achieve departmental targets.   
· Manage order entry, processing, and order book monitoring to ensure timely fulfilment.   
· Build strong operational relationships with key customers through proactive communication and problem-solving.   
· Collaborate with Supply Chain, Sales, and S&OP teams to forecast and resolve delivery challenges.   
· Manage customer portals (such as SupplyOn) and maintain accurate data and documentation.   
· Support finance with invoice queries, credit/debit notes, and proactive communication on blocked deliveries.   
· Lead root-cause reviews following delivery or service issues, implementing "lessons learned" improvements.   
· Ensure compliance with export, customs and quality requirements for all customer deliveries.   
· Monitor customer KPIs and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives across the department.   
About You   
You'll be a confident communicator and natural leader with a solid background in customer service or supply chain, ideally within a manufacturing or engineering environment. You know how to manage people, systems and process flow to deliver exceptional results.   
Requirements:   
· Degree qualified (or equivalent experience through a proven track record).   
· Minimum 5 years' experience in Customer Service, Supply Chain or similar function.   
· Demonstrated experience in people management and process improvement.   
· Proficient in ERP systems (preferably M3) and Microsoft Office, particularly Excel.   
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills.   
· Organised, proactive, and detail-oriented with a problem-solving mindset.   
· Business fluent in English; additional languages an advantage.   
What's on Offer   
· Up to £40,000 per annum.   
· 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays   
· 10% discretionary bonus (up to 20% maximum).   
· Free onsite parking and EV charging.   
· Subsidised canteen.   
· Employee Assistance Programme and wellbeing portal.   
· A supportive, collaborative working environment with real career development potential.   
This is a site-based role in Leicester, with occasional international travel if required.   
If you're a driven and people-focused professional with a passion for service excellence and operational efficiency, we'd love to hear from you.
